Fields.DialogueText: Morgana ships rapidly approaching.
All crew, prepare for battle.
@BATTLE
Mon Capitaine! Did you see how easily that battle went?
It seemed pretty standard. Great work, everyone.
And?
Did you expect me to say something different?
I expected you to congratulate me on being such an important member of the crew! Not only that, but throwing a few compliments my way wouldn't hurt...

Fields.MenuText: Béarn, you did an incredible job today. Is that good enough?
You're awfully cute when you're excited. How's that?
What's your angle here?

Fields.DialogueText: You forgot to mention how beautiful I was! As well as to ask for some Béarnaise food to celebrate.
R-really? I mean, of course I am...thank you, sir!
The usual. I'm trying to gain your adoration, sir!
Now, let's go get something to eat!
I still have some things to do, Béarn.
Don't worry, mon capitaine! I will wait for you.
Well, if you wouldn't mind, I guess that's all right. You can tell me all about dinner and get me good and hungry.
Now this is where I shine! Now, then...1836. A restaurant where once dined Henri IV himself. The world does not realize it yet, but the most wonderful sauce is due to be served...
How do you know that'll work?
You're just going to have to trust me! Do you remember where I'm from? The land of romance!
How do you know anything about romance?
Not only am I the toughest Belle, but I'm the smartest-oh, mon capitaine!
Giving the crew some advice?
I was just telling him some crucial information about how to win the battle of love!

Fields.MenuText: I don't think that you could call love a "battle."
Define crucial information.
As long as you aren't distracting them from any important duties, you may continue on.

Fields.DialogueText: Of course it is! Tougher than the Morganas themselves! Love can be a ruthless and terrifying enemy!
Well, this individual is going to be able to visit his loved one after our next resupply operation. So I gave him a few tips and some food!
Please, sir! This is important!
As much as I've enjoyed this past hour, I really must get going.
Did he just say an hour? You talked at a crew member for an hour? Did they at least get a word out?
Of course he did! Besides, what is an hour compared to an eternity with the one you love?
@BATTLE
...All right, at least I know it comes from the heart.
Capitaine, we've been at this for quite some time.
You mean the Morganas?
Yes! But I feel like you've been quite distant in talking about your personal side!
What are you saying?
That I feel like it's my turn to get to know you! Now tell me, sir. Do you have someone?
Have someone?
Do you care for somebody? Are you interested in a certain individual?

Fields.MenuText: I guess you could say that I am. But it's a recent feeling.
Believe it or not, I do. But she's a tricky one...
Do you have someone that you're interested in?

Fields.DialogueText: Oh?! How exciting! I've always cherished those feelings! I'm in the same situation as you!
Some people are! But they're worth it! I promise!
Well...this is about you, sir! Not me!
You should watch what I do! You could learn a thing or two about how to impress someone special!
@BATTLE
I don't know if you've noticed, Béarn, but I can't exactly launch aircraft.
And I cannot disappear into port for thoughtful gifts for my favorite Belle. We all have our strengths.
Béarn, what are you talking about?
My point exactly!
There's no point to that. You're obviously doing it for yourself.
I want to because the captain needs something during these sorts of times!
You can ask the captain, but it won't happen.
With my charm, anything is possible!
Bugging an officer?
No, sir. I was just on my way out.
Yes, he had no business here with you. Unlike me!
Were you trying to secure some more Béarnaise food for yourself?
Of course not! I think you've been working too hard. You need some time spent with me!

Fields.MenuText: Do you keep forgetting we're at war?
I'd love to. What would we be doing?
How sweet of you. You like me that much?

Fields.DialogueText: No, but I know that it can be tiring to constantly be on edge all the time. I want to help you!
R-really? My, Capitaine! You catch this Belle off guard with your acceptance!
W-well...I'm just concerned about your health, sir.
*ALARM*
Hold that thought.
@BATTLE
Perhaps I shall, Capitaine...
I see you eyeing my Béarnaise meal! Would you like some, sir?
Sure.
Ok! Now, open wide!
What do you think you're doing? Why did you just say that?
Come on! Take a break! It's a trust exercise!

Fields.MenuText: I've never heard of a trust exercise involving feeding someone.
No matter how I feel about this, the entire crew is all here eating their lunch. I'm not getting fed like a child in public.
You're gonna spill it on me. Don't get near me...

Fields.DialogueText: It's a new exercise sweeping the world! Now come on! Indulge this gorgeous Belle!
Just a quick one! Come on! No one will see!
When have I ever spilt something on you, sir?
Here we go...oops!
Great. Now I'm covered in food. Again.
Well...at least you still look tasty to me, sir!
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Always wanted to face a Morgana with Béarnaise down my uniform.
Oh, it's not going to kill you! I'll run it down to the laundry once we're done.
Morganas inbound, Capitaine!
Let's get to our positions!
Be prepared to watch my amazing demonstration!
Don't do anything that could put us all in danger.
I would never! Now sit back and watch how I demolish the Morganas!
@BATTLE
Threats neutralized! I am now ready to accept every compliment, sir!

Fields.MenuText: Why are you so expecting of praise? You've been more energetic lately.
Uhh...great job?
Great work, Béarn! Impressive as always!

Fields.DialogueText: I'm just excited to be a part of this crew, sir!
Come on! Don't be nervous! I deserve some proper recognition!
Oh, sir! You'll make me blush!
Of course, I wouldn't be the Belle I am without the fine folks at the Société Nouvelle!
Here she goes...But it's oddly endearing.
Now then, I'd been around for nine years before they decided I should be the greatest carrier of all...
Multiple Morganas have been spotted in the area, sir.
Proceed with caution.
Mon Capitaine, there you are! I need advice.
Interesting. You need advice? I thought I'd never see the day when you were stuck.
A proper lady is never afraid to admit when she's stuck! Now will you hear me out?
Sure thing.
I remember us discussing romance a while ago and I'm curious about something.
Just get to the point, Béarn.
How do you tell someone how you feel about them?

Fields.MenuText: I'm not really sure. Just tell them, I guess...
Do you care for someone on this ship?
Ask them on a date?

Fields.DialogueText: Is it that easy, sir?
That's not important! I just need answers!
Hmm...that might work...
Is this why you've been acting so differently?
Why, I haven't a clue what you're talking about!
Your leg's twitching, Béarn. It's making your rapier rattle.
Oh, that! Hahaha...well, you see, it, ah, does that when there are enemies near! Dear me, here they come now!
We'll table this, but I think I'm on the right track...
@BATTLE
It's funny. Béarn seems to have been not acting like herself. Yet she can still manage to keep me waiting for her...I thought I talked to her about this...
Sir! There you are! I've been-ahh!
Don't worry, I got you. You really are clumsy, aren't you?
I fell on purpose, I swear!
I doubt that. You seemed really shocked. No way you could've faked that.
It was a test!

Fields.MenuText: A test for what? Just admit that you slipped and fell!
Another trust exercise? I highly doubt that.
I don't need excuses. Just be more careful, okay?

Fields.DialogueText: Why...your reflexes, of course! Yes, that's it.
Trust and reflexes! You've shown how quickly you spring to the defense of the ship and my crew!
Sorry, sir. Thank you for catching me...and so quickly...
Yes, that's it. You've passed your reflex test with flying colors!
*ALARM*
Is this where you test my strength?
Capitaine, I don't under-
Gah! M-mon capitaine...
You're clearly unsteady on your feet. I'll carry you to the bridge.
Of course, Capitaine! Just as I'd planned...all along..before right now.
@BATTLE
Captain, I found this book lying around. Is it yours?
Tales of the Heptaméron? Not familiar with it.
Well, nothing just magically appears on the ship. Think it belongs to the Belle?
Béarn? It might.
Oh and could you tell Béarn that her special request of Béarnaise food has been transferred?

Fields.MenuText: You're Béarn's food connection?
Looks like I found out how Béarn gets all the fancy food that she wants.
When were you going to tell me that you're responsible for the fancy cuisine on my ship?

Fields.DialogueText: Well...I thought you knew...
You aren't responsible for that? I thought you were the reason we got all the Béarnaise food...
But didn't you order it, sir?
Has Béarn been tricking us, sir?
At some point I may have said something to her...
Don't forget about the book, sir.
Never a dull moment. Don't worry. I'll talk to her about this.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
These Morganas are putting up a fight today. I will teach them humility!
@BATTLE
I always love sharing some of my brandy with you, sir! It's nice to just take some time for yourself after a hard fight.
I guess every now and then is fine. Oh I almost forgot to mention...does this book belong to you, Béarn?
My Tales of the Heptaméron! I was wondering where this was!
One of the officers found it. I noticed it was all in French.
Of course it is! It is from France, after all!
What's it about?
Romance, love triangles, distressed damsels...That sort of thing...

Fields.MenuText: You like that sort of stuff? Interesting.
Be more careful of your things. It would be a tragedy if you lost something important.
Too bad I can't read it...

Fields.DialogueText: Of course I do! It's all so endearing and fascinating!
Luckily I have you to help find them! I'll never get lost as long as I have you around, sir!
I know...Wait! I could teach you some French if you wanted!
Anyway, you've saved me again! You truly are something special, sir!
Happy to be of assistance. Your bookmark even stayed in it.
My...bookmark? W-why, I haven't the faintest idea-
"He then jumped into bed to his mistress without delay. Fear had not cooled his ardor..."
Gremlins! They're back! I can feel them crawling all over my engines!
Quite the disappearing act. I'll just leave this here...
You're in big trouble, Capitaine! You've been neglecting to adhere to my teachings!
What? Why?
You haven't been whistling lately! Have you learned nothing from me?!
Your lessons on etiquette never specified whistling as a mandatory thing...
It should have been implied that it was!
Why not just say that whistling was mandatory? It isn't, by the way.
It should be! Just so you know, I find someone more appealing if they share my love for whistling!

Fields.MenuText: You like somebody more if they just whistle? You really are a bizarre Belle...
In that case...I'll whistle more often.
Are you looking for me to impress you?

Fields.DialogueText: If by bizarre you mean outstanding, then yes! I am very bizarre!
Great! You're back on the right track!
Well...it doesn't hurt to impress people...
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
That's quite the pack of Morganas...
Aha! Capitaine, that surprised sound you just made! I knew we'd make a whistler of you yet. Do it again!
Do what now?
Grr...We'll pick it up later. Shells can whistle too!
I wish I could be like you, Béarn...
Why do you say that?
You never seem worried at all about the Morganas.
Really?
You are always laid back. I've reprimanded you for it before, but there's value in it.
It's because I trust the crew...
...And I have full trust in the Captain!
The only time I've ever seen you trip up or get anxious is...

Fields.MenuText: ...When I happen to be around?
...When she's interrupted while reading? What was that book...?
When she's doing my laundry?

Fields.DialogueText: W-well, you would not be my capitaine if you could not surprise me!
Ah...a cookbook? Yes, because I get so...lost in thought about planning exquisite dinners...heh...
Capitaine! That was one time!
*ALARM*
What are you all standing around for? There are monsters on the waves!
I don't know what you roped me into, but I really do think she's something special.
So do I, sailor...so do I.
@BATTLE
Mind if I join you? You seem relaxed!
You're always welcome here, Béarn. What's that you're holding? It doesn't look like your drink of choice.
I thought that I'd give you something special! It's Jurançon wine!
Jurançon wine?
I usually save it for my pilots...but I think you deserve a bottle.

Fields.MenuText: That's awfully kind of you, Béarn. Let's drink some!
I should get you something nice now.
You keep surprising me.

Fields.DialogueText: What? I don't drink Jurançon! You can, though! I'll watch.
Aw! You don't need to get me anything! But now that you mention it...
Of course I do! Aren't I great?
Perhaps in return...some new reading material?
I'll see what I can do!
Thank you so much, Capitaine! I've almost finished my Heptaméron.
Ah, yes, of course. I picked myself up a copy, as it happens.
Ah...did you now?
I love the language Marguerite de Navarre uses. What was that one phrase? "Nocturnal confabulations?"
Ah...yes, in XIII. That story also concerned a captain, did it not? Who fell in l-l-l-
-Look over there! Morganas!
Phew...
@BATTLE
Béarn...I'm suspicious of you.
Mon Capitaine! I haven't done anything wrong!
It's about your seemingly endless supply of Béarnaise food...
Nothing suspicious about it! It's fine! No need to question a woman's secrets.

Fields.MenuText: It might not matter to you, but I'd enjoy some clarity...
I trust you, Béarn. I just want to know how you constantly get a hold of special food...
Béarn. I need an answer.

Fields.DialogueText: Hmm...I guess you've earned an explanation...
It's not that exciting! But if you're this inquisitive...
Fine. But it's not as grand as you'd believe.
Since I took so long to be constructed, I became a favorite among my nation!
So?
So they treat me nicely! I get amazing food from them! I just have to win the war.
Is that your motivation?
Well, not really! But it's a huge component!
Guess that's all I needed to know. Your liaison among our crew was tight-lipped.
Not tight-lipped enough...if I were Verdun, I'd sew them shut!
...The destroyer? What's she have to do with sewing?
Oh, my...she's going to be so cross with me. Us Belles and our secret loves...Forget you heard anything, Capitaine.
*ALARM*
Shouldn't be hard. Ought to get that klaxon replaced...
@BATTLE
I think it's time for you to grow as a leader, sir!
You don't already look up to me?
Leave the boasting to me. I was hoping that I could assist you in expanding your perspective!
How do you plan on doing that?
I want to teach you some French!
What will that accomplish?
Cela vous rendra plus éloquent!
Come again?
It will make you more eloquent! So how about it?

Fields.MenuText: Sure, anything to pass the time.
It's a good idea. We can do this later.

Fields.DialogueText: Excellent! Let's begin!
Magnifique!
*ALARM*
Merde ces sorcières!
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: You don't think it's too late for me to pick it up?

Fields.DialogueText: Never! Especially with a teacher like me.
Now what's that mean?
That will not be your first lesson...but it will be a fun one!
Are you ready for another round?
Another round of what?
You know what! Trust exercises!
You're not going to feed me. Drop it.
Get this...we feed each other! Double the trust for one another!
I do have a spare uniform hanging in my quarters...
I swear I won't spill any on you! Honestly!
I'm the Captain in the midst of a war!
And I'm an incredible battleship! Now, open up!

Fields.MenuText: Fine...just this once. Never speak of this. Understand?
Not going to happen.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, relax! I told the crew to avert their eyes.
You will! Maybe not today, but eventually!

Fields.MenuText: You'd better be ready to do some laundry.

Fields.DialogueText: Not so loud, Capitaine! People might talk.
You're starching it, too. Don't forget.
So forceful! No wonder you rose through the ranks.
*ALARM*
And now we're fighting on an empty stomach.
Never in a million years! I keep a jar of Béarnaise on my person at all times. Grab a potato and join me on the bridge!
@BATTLE
Mon capitaine, I've been thinking...
What about?
Well, I've taught you how to be classy and trustworthy, so I think it's time for you to put all of it to the test!
Ok. What's the test?
A dinner with yours truly! The most beautiful Belle around!

Fields.MenuText: If I'm not mistaken, you've just asked me on a date, Béarn.
Nothing would be better than a romantic dinner with you.
Like I said. You're cute when you get like this.

Fields.DialogueText: I-I mean. W-well...if you want to call it a date...
Already you're showing how much of an elegant person you are! It's a date!
I am always cute, sir!
When we get some time, we'll get started!
Your place or mine?
Ha! You are such a joker, Capitaine! The whole ship is my place.
My quarters, then. Nobody will bother us.
Why, Capitaine, that sounds...
Delightful? I agree.
*ALARM*
And that sounds like trouble. Better secure that rapier - you don't want it slipping out during battle.
Ah! Of-of course, mon capitaine!
@BATTLE
Did you notice my hair, Captain?
What about it?
Come on! It's braided! Take a closer look!
I'm not seeing anything different...Did you style it?
I accessorized it! Look! Jetons of King Henri IV!
Your favorite! It looks great.
Would you ever stylize yourself with your homeland?

Fields.MenuText: I don't know...there's just so much to choose from.
Maybe. I wouldn't want to go overboard.
It seems fun. I think I would.

Fields.DialogueText: You're not selling your soul! Give it a try one of these days.
You can never go too overboard! At least...I cannot...
It's fun! Trust me!
I think I'll stick with what I'm wearing now. You Belles have it easy, though. You awoke looking the way you do.
For the most part, Capitaine. Hairstyle, clothing, accessories...but those things can be changed. I know of a British Belle who takes trophies!
From the Morganas? That sounds incredibly dangerous.
They'd all look better on fire anyway. Most of us pick up things from here and there...keepsakes that remind us of home.
Maybe I should help you out with that. I'll keep an eye out in port.
I'd love that, Capitaine! We'll fight those Morganas with style.
We'd better stick to planes for this pack...
@BATTLE
Béarn, were you hit?
I've had worse. It is time to end this battle!
@BATTLE
That last fight got me thinking about the Morganas...
Thinking about them in what way?
Do you think that they have taste?
You lost me...
Who in this wide world does not appreciate a fine meal?

Fields.MenuText: What brought this on?
I...I don't really have an answer. I wasn't expecting this conversation.
It doesn't matter in the end. They're still our enemy.

Fields.DialogueText: Optimism. Maybe they'll realize how good our food is and stop fighting! We can teach them our culture. Maybe?
It's had to have crossed your mind at one point, sir. You command me, after all!
That's true. But it doesn't hurt to wonder...does it?
This early in the war, and with how little we know...who knows? But if we try it, you carry it out.
Do you think my pilots would be willing to drop some rations?
Good luck selling that to Zurich.
But then I'd have to use my personal stash...it appears we're at an impasse.
Don't give up, Béarn. Progress marches on, one way or another...
Captain...!
*ALARM*
I know. Battle stations!
@BATTLE
Mon capitaine! I have an urgent issue to discuss with you!
Sounds serious! Come in! What's the problem? Did we not clear out the Morganas?
No! It is about you, sir!
What-wait...huh?
We are going to "date." Soon...correct?
Well we're sharing a meal together, so yes...
We must be properly dressed!

Fields.MenuText: Um...that doesn't matter, Béarn. What matters is that we relax. It's a simple meal.
A bit late to start thinking about our wardrobes.
We don't have time for that.

Fields.DialogueText: Really? We just be ourselves? It's that easy?
I know...but I want it to be special!
We should make time! The Morganas can wait!
Just relax, Béarn. I hate to see you worried.
Thank you, sir...it's just that I've never really done this before, and...
I've never dated an aircraft carrier. That's what makes this fun.
Learning...yes, of course. That's what this is all about!
I might get you a new scabbard when I'm in port next. Your blade sounds pretty loose in there.
Gah!
It can't be sooner, can it?
Sorry ma'am. You just can't. You already promised us the brandy...
It's for the captain, though! Surely they'd understand!
They're all too happy about having a night off. I can't take that away from them.
There a problem here?
Well...I wanted to get us some of my favorite brandy for our dinner together-
She already promised us some for the crew to celebrate how well the crew is doing.

Fields.MenuText: The crew comes first. We can always have something different to drink, Béarn.
A promise is a promise.

Fields.DialogueText: You're right. As much as I dislike it, we can try to think of something else...
Okay...
It's in the quartermaster's hands now. I've been doing a little research of my own...apparently white wine pairs well with our intended meal?

Fields.MenuText: Béarn, you didn't bring enough for everyone?

Fields.DialogueText: H-hey, now! Let me explain...
No need to dwell on my mistake, then! You always think of something.
Say, you must be stressed from all that planning. Trust exercise?
Capitaine, I'm afraid I don't know what you-
-Ah!
Hold on tight. We've got Morganas.
Avec plaisir!
@BATTLE
This will do nicely. They'll never know it was me...
Béarn?
Just sneak in and grab one bottle...
What are you doing in there? And what are you mumbling about?
N-nothing! I'm just thinking about the crew!
You're still upset from being denied your brandy for our date?
Maybe...
You weren't planning to do a booze heist...were you?
I was going to just borrow some...

Fields.MenuText: You're not going to take anything from anyone.
I'm guessing you won't be talked out of this?
And how exactly do you borrow a drink?

Fields.DialogueText: S-sure! I won't do it! I was just thinking out loud...and acting out loud...
I'm doing this for us! Now help me plan the best course of action!
I suppose there's no returning it...
*ALARM*
They just don't give up, do they?
No, but you have permission to where your little heist is concerned. In fact, I'm making it an order.
As you wish, Capitaine...
Besides, the white wine will taste all the sweeter for our victory.
@BATTLE
I've been wondering, sir...
About what? You seem a little uneasy. Everything okay?
It's just that...I feel like I let you down. About the brandy.
You know why you feel that way.
And inattentive as I can be, well, I would almost certainly have gotten caught. The crew must be laughing at me behind my back...

Fields.MenuText: Are you serious? Where did this come from? You're an amazing person, Béarn.
That's not true! You're the reason that morale is so high.

Fields.DialogueText: You really mean that? Maybe it's all the fighting that's wearing me down...I wasn't thinking clearly.
You always know the right thing to say, sir.
Now come on. Let's go chat with that crew and have some fun. We can all laugh at you face to face.
*ALARM*
Perhaps I shall try my hand at it!
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: You did promise that stock to the crew. They're allowed.

Fields.DialogueText: Maybe they are. Don't worry, I know I'm being foolish. The feelings come and go.
Don't be horrid, Capitaine!
Don't be predictable.
A little trickery comes in handy now and again in battle.
Be careful what you wish for, Capitaine! Some of the other Belles are not so honest and open. Some of them are true schemers.
Captain, I am sensing Morganas close by and approaching fast.
Sound the alarm. Béarn, prepare for battle.
@BATTLE
Guess what I got!
Something to celebrate today's victory?
It's brandy! My favorite! I got it for our date! I figured we could discuss the plan over a drink.
I thought that you promised the crew-
That doesn't matter! We have it now! Drink up!
Wait...Béarn...isn't this why you felt bad earlier?
Doesn't matter! Drink!

Fields.MenuText: You did the booze heist...didn't you?
I'm not gonna question it anymore. Let's just drink.
Return it, Béarn. Let the crew have fun.

Fields.DialogueText: I...Capitaine, I cannot say! I...oh, well...
That's great to hear! Though...now you have wrung a confession from me.
You have it all wrong! I...
The truth is...I managed an extra bottle with the last shipment. Just for us.
Then why did you need to steal one?
Contingency plan. I wasn't sure if my contact could get one on such short notice. And he's already proven such a lackluster secret keeper...
You don't have to keep secrets from me, Béarn. Wasn't that what all the trust exercises were about?
Capitaine...I must admit that they-
-Were an attempt to disguise your feelings. It didn't work, but it sure was endearing.
I...I am sorry, Capitaine. I talked a big game about trust, only to prove myself untrustworthy. You must think I'm terrible.
I think you're ridiculous and brash and impossible to stop once you've gotten started...and that's exactly what I love about you.
Mon capitaine...
Votre capitaine.
I hope this fight is not as hairy as our last one!
You and me both, sailor. You and me both.
@BATTLE
Capitaine, what is this?
I found it in port. You're always going on about how you kit yourself out with things from your home...I found one.
Oh, my! Capitaine, what is it?

Fields.MenuText: The Three Musketeers. The main character's from Béarn.
After dinner. This is how you keep someone guessing.
You promise to keep it safe?

Fields.DialogueText: Aaaah! Capitaine, thank you! I've been meaning to read it since...well, since I awoke!
You're such a tease, Capitaine! But I suppose I can wait.
I'd weave it into my hair if I could!
I know you'll love it. This looks excellent, Béarn...you outdid yourself.
Y-you really mean that, Capitaine?
Every word. You'll find I'm a fairly direct person.
Then...then why didn't you tell me before? About your feelings?
I almost did. Then you suggested the date, and I knew I had to wait for the occasion.
A true capitaine acts with patience and strikes decisively when the time is right. I knew I chose correctly!
That, and you're really funny when you try to be sneaky.
Hmph! You should hire a jester, then.
I will not. Because you're cute when you're funny.
I am always cute!
And well read. And inspiring. And an absolute titan on the battlefield.
You make me blush...I love that about you, you know?
No faking that.
